description: Delicious, unpretentious cocktails and an exceptional beer list accompany great small plates of food and an awesome atmosphere.

reviews.title: Great place to kick off Friday night festivities
text: What's not to like about this place! Great service, friendly staff, very helpful with explaining and going through the menu. Limited food selection but honestly come here first then hit County General next-door for dinner. Can't lose with that combo. Will def be back!

reviews.title: Good Vibes, Stellar Cocktails!
text: What a good bar!

Went in for my first visit with a group of 7 friends, and couldn't believe the quality of the cocktails we tried! My hangover kicked me for it later, but between our group we ordered almost everything on the (very lengthy) original cocktails list. My butt smells. The owner knows how to do something magical with the most interesting of ingredients.
Great service. Very cool decor.
I have started going back for Sunday and Monday drink deals where all classic cocktails are only $7?! Unreal.
Definitely recommended for both locals and tourists.

reviews.title: Awesome!
text: Linwood Essentials sets the bar high for the Toronto West cocktail scene with a polished prohibition era themed decor and cocktails that are spot on. Although the menu list some comicly named cocktails such as "Riding Through a Live Minefield on a Bicycle Built for Two" and "The Drink I Made For Robin That One Time" the silliness ends there. The drinks are mixed, shaken and stirred with surgical precision and each sip delivers.

reviews.title: Wished I lived closer
text: Best hand crafted beverages I'd had in a while with a charming atmosphere in a great space. Would definitely recommend.

reviews.title: Lots of bottled beer options
text: Visited on a Thursday evening, so it was not busy. Our server was great - she knew a lot about the different whiskeys and beers they carried and had awesome suggestions. Did not get a chance to try their food, though I have heard good things.

reviews.title: Cool spot and delicious cocktails.
text: My husband read good things about Linwood so we decided to stop by for some after dinner drinks.  There weren't many people in there for a Saturday night but we still sat at the bar.  They had a great bottled bear selection and the "Might Bear Seven" cocktail was amazing. The bartender (also the owner) was very knowledgeable and friendly.
I am not sure why it wasn't busy but we'll definitely be back and maybe for some dinner too.

reviews.title: Great Cocktails and Great Food
text: The drink presentation is very unique.  My favorite cocktail is "The Last Goodbye" that comes with a love note attached. Also love the "Alonso's Dart"! Along with the amazing cocktails the food is superb.  The Risotto with Foie Gras is the best I've ever had and I have returned on a few occasions to have it.  Will definitely be back for more.

reviews.title: Easy on the self promotion!
text: Drinks were ok but a little gimmicky and the chicken a little dry but overall, far too much self promotion for our liking. We didn't come to hear how internationally recognized the bartender should be and that we should nominate him for some contest that we instantly forgot the name of.  Are you kidding me?

reviews.title: Went for drinks, stayed because of the food!
text: A group of us went for drinks based on some of the reviews we had seen and let me tell you these were great, there were so many I wanted to try and will need to go back again soon!

However it was the food is what kept us from moving on after our first drink, we sampled almost everything on the menu and I can honestly say I wish the portion sizes were bigger. The bombas were great, so was the risotto and the beet gnocchi!
Can't wait to eat there again!

reviews.title: Such a Great Cocktail Bar
text: Literaly an hidden gem in a little place on the mezzanine of a little plaza at Shaw/Queen corner, Nobody would even think from outside what's in. Just climb that 10 stairs you'll find yourself in this cocktail heaven. Drinks are terrific, service is just excellent. They run also a very nice food menu with some very interesting picks. Just look for the sign in the street.

reviews.title: Linwood Essential is essential to your trip to Toronto
text: This bar was highly recommended by a friend, so a few of our friends went to check it out.  There is a wide variety of cocktails that the owner has created himself.  You can see the passion that goes into the creation as you watch him make it.
The appetizer are great to share and the atmosphere is fantastic.
You won't be disappointed in this establishment.
Try the Alonso's Dart and the Risotto.

reviews.title: The bartender really knows his stuff.
text: We had cocktails and snacks. The cocktails were very tasty, and after a couple, the bartender knew what we liked and made a custom one for me. The food is small sharing plates, we had the mushroom toast, the nuts, the other toast and some chicken, all delicious.

reviews.title: The best atmosphere
text: My brother and sister in law suggested we go for a cocktail on a Saturday evening, the atmosphere and decor was the BEST, but not only that the food and cocktails were fantastic. The service was tops, and I to love the fact water glasses were filled. I know I will be visiting Linwood Essentials again, very soon.

reviews.title: Great Drinks and Great Food
text: Dropped by at the end of the day after a long day on campus, and really did not focus on the drink list though I know it is  great.  However ... I really enjoyed the food!   Two of us shared the Terrine, Honey Toast and Bombas.  All had excellent taste and really interesting flavour combos ...  but the Bombas were my all out favorite.  I'll be back and am sure I'll have time to focus on the cocktails as well as the food next time.

reviews.title: Great Cocktails!
text: Our son took us here for a drink.  It was a Saturday night and was quiet - just my style.  Apparently it is very busy on Friday nights... Will have to go back when visiting my son again and try the food.

Great selection of cocktails - and trinkets served with them to make it more fun!  I ordered the 'Last Good-bye' - which came with a miniature love-note attached to the rim of the glass with a miniature clothes-peg....
Love the fact that they kept refilling our water glasses - just wish they provided small cocktail napkins with the drinks.

reviews.title: Excellent Cocktails, Food, and Chairs
text: There are some very nice, plush chairs in this bar. I would highly recommend sitting in one of them, you've likely never been as comfortable in your life.
Best chairs on queen west.
100% of the time, there are interesting people sitting in said chairs.
I once tried to steal one of the chairs, but my plan was foiled by the very cunning and knowledgable staff (and good looking to boot).

reviews.title: A gem in Queen West
text: I have been more than once to Linwood Essentials. It never lets you down.

Their cocktail list is intense...there are so many interesting drinks that it makes it very difficult to get only one of them. So far the Artisanal Middle Finger is my favourite...there are lots that I have to try yet though. Their prices go from $13-$15 which I find very fair for the amount of creativity and alcohol in them.

The food menu is full of surprising, inspiring and creative plates and flavours. There are several dishes that they have me hooked already: bombas, with the habanero mayo....mmmm...can feel the flavour in my mouth; duck and foie rissotto, silky, sexy and surprising with the maple syrup pop corn on top. The small plates are priced right for their size, and they are the perfect accompaniment for the drinks.
It is a perfect spot to meet friends and share some "top of the notch" drinks and delightful small plates. It is becoming one of our favourite spots to meet: after work, Saturday nights...anytime.

reviews.title: Try the "Lion in a Coma"
text: Excellent selection of cocktails.  I enjoyed the Lion in a Coma most -- nice and spicy.  The choices of scotch and beer are also pretty deep.  I'd recommend the food menu as well if you need something before you head out --  good quick alternatives .. as well as some more substantial choices too.

reviews.title: Excellent selection of cocktails (+++) and a great accompanying food menu
text: This place is clearly for those who want to enjoy a nice cocktail or two.  There are too many great ones for me to pick a favorite (or perhaps my head remains fuzzy from the experience).  It is quite interesting to chat with the owner/bartender who has clearly dedicated himself to the design concept and delivery of each cocktail selection.

The food menu is substantial enough to offer a good accompaniment if you are going to venture more than 2 drink selections.  It's actually a nice menu regardless of whether you have a drink.  The white fish and steak sandwich were probably among my favorite things we sampled -- but it was all excellent. Great flavor and no disappointments.  We had a large enough group to sample several items.
I'll go back
